page.title: 17WORKING IN DALRY FACTORY
page.content: My working day is from 7a.m. to 3p.m. As the shift utilities engineer, I am in charge of a 200M.W. power station with self-generating capacity of 23M.W. My job involves supplying steam, electricity, cooling water, brine and nitrogen for the manufacture of vitamin powders. Four operators and another shift engineer help meet the demands made by the production side. In these days of ever increasing technology, most of my job is in the central control room where I can monitor the utilities operation from the instrumentation. If an alarm or malfunction develops, instruction can be passed on immediately by a multitone intercom system. The job is interesting as it covers a wide range of operations, machinery and equipment.
